panels.description: Number of active controllers in the cluster. Alert if the aggregated sum across all brokers in the cluster is anything other than 1 because there should be exactly one controller per cluster.
panels.title: Active Controller

panels.description: Number of partitions that donâ€™t have an active leader and are hence not writable or readable. Alert if value is greater than 0.
panels.title: Offline Partitions Count

panels.description: Number of under-replicated partitions (| ISR | < | all replicas |). Alert if value is greater than 0.
panels.title: Under Replicated Partitions

panels.description: Number of under-replicated partitions (| ISR | < | min.insync.replicas  |). Alert if value is greater than 0.
panels.title: Partitions Under Min ISR

options.content: You're using Apache Kafka, an open-source distributed and fault-tolerant streaming platform originally built at LinkedIn. For more information, check out the kafka.apache.org

panels.description: Total number of brokers with a state running (i.e 3)
panels.title: Brokers Running(>=3)

panels.description: Total number of producer requests per second
panels.title: Produce Req Per Sec

panels.description: Number of metadata requests per sec
panels.title: Metadata Req Per Sec

panels.description: When a broker is brought up after a failure, it starts catching up by reading from the leader. Once it is caught up, it gets added back to the ISR.
panels.title: In-Sync Replica Expands Rate

panels.description: If a broker goes down, ISR for some of the partitions will shrink. When that broker is up again, ISR will be expanded once the replicas are fully caught up. Other than that, the expected value for both ISR shrink rate and expansion rate is 0.
panels.title: In-Sync Replica Shrinks Rate

panels.description: Number of leaders on each broker. This should be mostly even across all brokers. If not, set auto.leader.rebalance.enable to true on all brokers in the cluster.
panels.title: Leader Count Per Broker
